001package gbw.melange.common.shading.generative.voronoi;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh;
004import gbw.melange.common.shading.IManagedShader;
005import gbw.melange.common.shading.constants.InterpolationType;
006import gbw.melange.common.shading.constants.Vec2DistFunc;
007import gbw.melange.common.shading.generative.noise.NoiseProvider;
008/**
009 * <p>IVoronoiFragmentBuilder interface.</p>
010 *
011 * @author GustavBW
012 * @version $Id: $Id
013 */
014public interface IVoronoiFragmentBuilder {
015
016    int MAX_NUM_POINTS = 100;
017
018    /**
019     * Add a specific point up to a maximum of {@link IVoronoiFragmentBuilder#MAX_NUM_POINTS}.
020     * If points are provided through this builder, the builder will mark the generated shader as static,
021     * and if the pipeline is present, it will be cached automatically.
022     * This is the default behaviour for performance reasons, and can be overwritten using {@link IManagedShader#setStatic(boolean)}
023     * immediately afterwards.
024     */
025    IVoronoiFragmentBuilder addPoint(double x, double y);
026
027    /**
028     * Extract vertex position information from mesh and use as points for voronoi. Ignores Z.
029     * Declaring points up front incurs some assumptions if the pipeline is in play see {@link IVoronoiFragmentBuilder#addPoint(double, double)}
030     */
031    IVoronoiFragmentBuilder vertsAsPoints(Mesh mesh);
032
033    /**
034     * Add any amount of randomly distributed points. All points' parameters are in a 0-1 space.
035     * The default noise implementation is PerlinNoise
036     * Declaring points up front incurs some assumptions if the pipeline is in play see {@link IVoronoiFragmentBuilder#addPoint(double, double)}
037     */
038    IVoronoiFragmentBuilder addRandomPoints(int num);
039
040    /**
041     * Add any amount of randomly distributed points from some provider implementing {@link NoiseProvider}.
042     * Declaring points up front incurs some assumptions if the pipeline is in play see {@link IVoronoiFragmentBuilder#addPoint(double, double)}
043     * @param num amount of points
044     * @param provider
045     *    {@code () -> double }
046     */
047    IVoronoiFragmentBuilder addRandomPoints(int num, NoiseProvider provider);
048
049    /**
050     * Set the distance function this shader should use to determine the distance between the pixel in question and the sourrounding points.
051     * @default {@link Vec2DistFunc#EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED}
052     */
053    IVoronoiFragmentBuilder setDistanceType(Vec2DistFunc type);
054
055    /**
056     * Set the interpolation type used to determine the resulting color based on the distance.
057     * In this case {@link InterpolationType#NONE} is allowed if one does not wish to map the color into a 0..1 range.
058     * @default {@link InterpolationType#HERMIT}
059     */
060    IVoronoiFragmentBuilder setInterpolationType(InterpolationType interpolationType);
061
062    IVoronoiShader build();
063}
